prompt_markdown: Explain the difference between **kernel mode** and **user mode**. Why does the CPU have these two modes, and how does a process switch between them?

criteria.name: modes
criteria.description: Correctly explains both modes and their privilege levels

criteria.name: purpose
criteria.description: Explains why separation exists (protection, stability, security)

criteria.name: transition
criteria.description: Describes how transitions occur (syscalls, interrupts, exceptions)

expected_key_points: kernel mode has full hardware access
prevents buggy programs from crashing the system
syscalls trigger controlled transition to kernel mode
common_mistakes: thinking user mode can access hardware directly
not mentioning how the transition is controlled
confusing with process privilege (root vs user)
